abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Support
            for Social Services Project for Guatemala is to preserve
            health and education services following severe flooding and
            other natural disasters that took place in Guatemala between
            May and September 2010. The closing date for the project
            will be extended from June 30, 2012 until December 31, 2012.
            The loan was approved by the Guatemalan Congress on November
            24, 2011, and became effective on December 22, 2011. A
            retroactive disbursement of US$40 million was made on
            December 29, 2011, and the request for a second disbursement
            is currently being prepared. The project implementation has
            been satisfactory and progress towards achieving the project
            development objective remains on track. The extension is
            necessary in light of the delayed Congressional approval and
            the resulting delay in the effectiveness of the loan. The
            extension will give the Borrower a full 12 months for
            implementation of the project. This will be the first
            extension of the project.
